qas.question: During which season of American Idol did Fox beat the other networks in ratings for the first time?
Why were television ratings down across the board during American Idols seventh season?
On what season was Kristy Lee Cook a contestant on American Idol?
Who was eliminated during the lowest rated show since season one?
What was the series' third most watched finale?
Because of the rebound in viewers, Fox became what for the first time?
What happened in 2007-2008 that had a drop in viewers for all networks?

context: The loss of viewers continued into <a0_0><a2_0><a4_0>season seven<a4_0/><a2_0/><a0_0/>. The premiere was down 11% among total viewers, and the results show in which <a3_0>Kristy Lee Cook<a3_0/> was eliminated delivered its lowest-rated Wednesday show among the 18–34 demo since the first season in 2002. However, the ratings rebounded for the season seven finale with the excitement over the battle of the Davids, and improved over season six as the series' third most watched finale. The strong finish of season seven also helped Fox become <a5_0>the most watched TV network<a5_0/> in the country for the first time since its inception, a first ever in American television history for a non-Big Three major broadcast network. Overall ratings for the season were down 10% from season six, which is in line with the fall in viewership across all networks due in part to the 2007–2008 <a1_0><a6_0>Writers Guild of America strike<a6_0/><a1_0/>.
